abstract: National Human Rights Commission of Mexico criticizes government’s investigation into disappearance of 43 college students, who investigators say were killed and incinerated in September 2014; makes recommendations that it says are vital to solving the case.
lead_paragraph: Investigators did not pursue numerous leads before concluding that the students had been arrested and then killed by a gang, a human rights group said.

headline.main: Mexican Panel Criticizes Inquiry in Missing Students Case
headline.print_headline: Mexican Panel Criticizes Inquiry in Missing Students Case

snippet: Investigators did not pursue numerous leads before concluding that the students had been arrested and then killed by a gang, a human rights group said.

keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
keywords.name: organizations
